englishTranslationText: Allah,	the	Most	Gracious
romanUrduTranslationText: Rahmān	ne

englishTranslationText:
Has	taught	the	Qur’an	to	His	beloved	
Prophet	(Muhammad	-	peace	and	
blessings	be	upon	him).
romanUrduTranslationText: Apne	Mehboob	ko	Qur’ān	sikhāya

englishTranslationText:
Has	created	Prophet	Muhammad	(peace	
and	blessings	be	upon	him)	as	the	soul	of	
mankind.
romanUrduTranslationText: Insāniyat	ki	jān	Muhammad	ko	paida	kiya

englishTranslationText:
Has	taught	him	the	knowledge	of	the	past	
and	the	future.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Mā-kāna	wa	mā	Yakoon	ka	bayān	unheiñ	
sikhāya

englishTranslationText: The	sun	and	the	moon	are	scheduled.
romanUrduTranslationText: Suraj	aur	chānd	hisāb	se	haiñ

englishTranslationText: And	the	plants	and	the	trees	prostrate	(for	Him).
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	sabze	aur	ped	sajda	karte	haiñ

englishTranslationText: And	Allah	has	raised	the	sky;	and	He	has	set	the	balance.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	āasmān	ko	Allah	ne	buland	kiya	aur	tarāzu	rakhi

englishTranslationText: In	order	that	you	may	not	corrupt	the	balance.
romanUrduTranslationText: Ke	tarāzu	meiñ	be-e’etedāli	(Na-insāfi	)	na	karo

arabicText: وَأَقِيمُوا۟ ٱلْوَزْنَ بِٱلْقِسْطِ وَلَا تُخْسِرُوا۟ ٱلْمِيزَانَ
englishTranslationText: And	establish	the	measures	justly,	nor	decrease	the	due	weight.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	insāf	ke	sāth	tol	qāim	karo	aur	wazan	na	ghatāo.

englishTranslationText: And	He	appointed	the	earth	for	the	creatures.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	zameen	rakhi	makhlooq	ke	liye

englishTranslationText: In	which	are	fruits,	and	covered	dates.
romanUrduTranslationText: Is	meiñ	mewe	aur	ghilāf	wāli	khajooreiñ

englishTranslationText: And	grain	covered	with	husk,	and	fragrant	flowers.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	bhus	ke	sāth	anāj	aur	khushboo	ke	phool

englishTranslationText: So	O	men	and	jinns!	Which	favour	of	your	Lord	will	you	deny?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	aey	Jinn-o-Ins!	Tum	donoñ	apne	Rab	ki	kaun	si	ne'mat	jhutlāoge.

englishTranslationText: He	created	man	from	clay	like	that	of	earthenware.
romanUrduTranslationText: Us	ne	āadmi	ko	banāya	bajti	mitti	se	jaise	thekri

arabicText: وَخَلَقَ ٱلْجَآنَّ مِن مَّارِجٍۢ مِّن نَّارٍۢ
englishTranslationText: And	created	jinn	from	the	flame	of	fire.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	Jin	ko	paida	farmāya	āag		ke	looke	se

englishTranslationText: So	O	men	and	jinns!	Which	favour	of	your	Lord	will	you	deny?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	tum	donoñ	apne	Rab	ki	kaun	si	ne’mat	jhutlāoge

englishTranslationText:
Lord	of	both	the	Easts,	and	Lord	of	both	
the	Wests!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Donoñ	poorab	ka	Rab	aur	donoñ	
pachchim	ka	Rab

englishTranslationText:
So	O	men	and	jinns!	Which	favour	of	your	
Lord	will	you	deny?
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	tum	donoñ	apne	Rab	ki	kaun	si	ne’mat	
jhutlāoge?

englishTranslationText:
He	has	set	flowing	two	seas	that	appear	to	
meet.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Us	ne	do	samandar	bahāaye	ke	dekhne	
meiñ	m’aloom	hoñ	mile	huwe

englishTranslationText:
Whereas	there	is	a	barrier	between	them	
so	they	cannot	encroach	upon	one	
another.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	hai	un	meiñ	rok	ke	ek	doosre	par	
badh	nahi	sakta

englishTranslationText:
So	O	men	and	jinns!	Which	favour	of	your	
Lord	will	you	deny?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	apne	Rab	ki	kaun	si	ne'mat	jhutlāoge?

englishTranslationText:
Pearls	and	coral-stone	come	forth	from	
them.
romanUrduTranslationText: Un	meiñ	se	moti	aur	mooñga	nikalta	hai

englishTranslationText:
So	O	men	and	jinns!	Which	favour	of	your	
Lord	will	you	deny?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	apne	Rab	ki	kaun	si	ne'mat	jhutlāoge?

arabicText: وَلَهُ ٱلْجَوَارِ ٱلْمُنشَـَٔاتُ فِى ٱلْبَحْرِ كَٱلْأَعْلَـٰمِ
englishTranslationText:
To	Him	only	belong	the	sailing	ships,	
raised	above	the	sea	like	hills.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	usi	ki	haiñ	woh	chalñe	wāliyañ	ke	
darya	meiñ	uthi	huyi	haiñ	jaise	pahād

englishTranslationText:
So	O	men	and	jinns!	Which	favour	of	your	
Lord	will	you	deny?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	apne	Rab	ki	kaun	si	ne'mat	jhutlāoge?

englishTranslationText: For	everything	on	the	earth	is	extinction.
romanUrduTranslationText: Zameen	par	jitne	haiñ	sab	ko	fanā	hai

arabicText: وَيَبْقَىٰ وَجْهُ رَبِّكَ ذُو ٱلْجَلَـٰلِ وَٱلْإِكْرَامِ
englishTranslationText:
And	everlasting	is	the	Entity	of	your	Lord,	
the	Most	Majestic	and	the	Most	
Honourable.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	bāqi	hai	tumhāre	Rab	ki	zāt	azmat	
aur-buzurgi	wāla

englishTranslationText:
So	O	men	and	jinns!	Which	favour	of	your	
Lord	will	you	deny?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	apne	Rab	ki	kaun	si	ne'mat	jhutlāoge?

englishTranslationText:
So	O	men	and	jinns!	Which	favour	of	your	
Lord	will	you	deny?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	apne	Rab	ki	kaun	si	ne'mat	jhutlāoge?

arabicText: يَسْـَٔلُهُۥ مَن فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ كُلَّ يَوْمٍ هُوَ فِى شَأْنٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
All	those	who	are	in	the	heavens	and	the	
earth	seek	only	from	Him;	every	day	is	an	enterprise	for	Him.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Usi	ke	mañgta	haiñ	jitne	āasmānoñ	aur	
zameen	meiñ	haiñ	usey	har	din	ek	kām	
hai

englishTranslationText: So	O	men	and	jinns!	Which	favour	of	your	Lord	will	you	deny?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	apne	Rab	ki	kaun	si	ne'mat	jhutlāoge?

englishTranslationText: Disposing	all	works	quickly	We	tend	towards	your	account,	O	you	two	large	groups!
romanUrduTranslationText: Jald	sab	kām	nibta	kar	hum	tumhāre	hisāb	ka	qasd	farmāte	haiñ	aey	donoñ!	bhāri	giroh

englishTranslationText: So	O	men	and	jinns!	Which	favour	of	your	Lord	will	you	deny?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	apne	Rab	ki	kaun	sí	ne'mat	jhutlāoge?

arabicText: يَـٰمَعْشَرَ ٱلْجِنِّ وَٱلْإِنسِ إِنِ ٱسْتَطَعْتُمْ أَن تَنفُذُوا۟ مِنْ أَقْطَارِ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ فَٱنفُذُوا۟ ۚ لَا تَنفُذُونَ إِلَّا بِسُلْطَـٰنٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
O	the	groups	of	jinns	and	men,	if	you	can	cross	the	boundaries	of	the	heavens	and	the	earth,	
then	cross	them;	wherever	you	may	go,	His	is	the	kingdom!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	jinn-o-insān!	ke	giroh	agar	tum	se	ho	sake	ke	āasmānoñ	aur	zameen	ke	kināroñ	se	nikal	jāo	
to	nikal	jāo	jahāñ	nikal	kar	jāoge	usi	ki	saltanat	hai

englishTranslationText: So	O	men	and	jinns!	Which	favour	of	your	Lord	will	you	deny?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	apne	Rab	ki	kaun	si	ne'mat	jhutlāoge?

arabicText: يُرْسَلُ عَلَيْكُمَا شُوَاظٌۭ مِّن نَّارٍۢ وَنُحَاسٌۭ فَلَا تَنتَصِرَانِ
englishTranslationText:
Flames	of	smokeless	fire	and	black	smoke	without	flames,	will	be	let	loose	on	you,	so	you	will	
not	be	able	to	retaliate.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	par	chordi	jāye	gi	be	dhuwyeñ	ki	āg	ki	lapat	aur	be	lapat	ka	kāla	dhuwāñ	to	phir	badla	na	le	
sakoge

englishTranslationText: So	O	men	and	jinns!	Which	favour	of	your	Lord	will	you	deny?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	apne	Rab	ki	kaun	si	ne'mat	jhutlāoge?

arabicText: فَإِذَا ٱنشَقَّتِ ٱلسَّمَآءُ فَكَانَتْ وَرْدَةًۭ كَٱلدِّهَانِ
englishTranslationText: And	when	the	heaven	will	split,	it	will	appear	like	a	rose	painted	red.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	jab	āsmān	phat	jāyega	to	gulāb	ke	phool	sa	ho	jāyega	jaise	surkh	nari	(Surkh	rañgā	huwa	
chamdā)

englishTranslationText: So	O	men	and	jinns!	Which	favour	of	your	Lord	will	you	deny?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	apne	Rab	ki	kaun	si	ne'mat	jhutlāoge?

arabicText: فَيَوْمَئِذٍۢ لَّا يُسْـَٔلُ عَن ذَنۢبِهِۦٓ إِنسٌۭ وَلَا جَآنٌّۭ
englishTranslationText: On	that	day	no	sinner	will	be	questioned	about	his	sins,	from	men	or	from	jinns.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	us	din	guneh-gār	ke	gunah	ki	poochh	na	hogi	kisi	Ādmi	aur	Jin	se

englishTranslationText: So	O	men	and	jinns!	Which	favour	of	your	Lord	will	you	deny?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	apne	Rab	ki	kaun	si	ne'mat	jhutlāoge?

arabicText: يُعْرَفُ ٱلْمُجْرِمُونَ بِسِيمَـٰهُمْ فَيُؤْخَذُ بِٱلنَّوَٰصِى وَٱلْأَقْدَامِ
englishTranslationText:
The	criminals	will	be	recognised	from	
their	faces,	so	will	be	caught	by	their	
forelocks	and	feet,	and	thrown	into	hell.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Mujrim	apne	chehre	se	pehchāne	jāyeñ	ge	
to	mātha	aur	pāoñ	pakad	kar	Jahannam	
meiñ	dāle	jāyeñ	ge

englishTranslationText:
So	O	men	and	jinns!	Which	favour	of	your	
Lord	will	you	deny?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	apne	Rab	ki	kaun	si	ne'mat	jhutlāoge?

arabicText: هَـٰذِهِۦ جَهَنَّمُ ٱلَّتِى يُكَذِّبُ بِهَا ٱلْمُجْرِمُونَ
englishTranslationText: This	is	hell,	which	the	criminals	deny.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yeh	hai	woh	Jahannam	jise	mujrim	
jhutlāte	haiñ

englishTranslationText:
They	shall	keep	going	back	and	forth	
between	it	and	the	extremely	hot	boiling	
water.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phere	kareñge	is	meiñ	aur	inteha	ke	jalte	
khaulte	pāni	meiñ

englishTranslationText:
So	O	men	and	jinns!	Which	favour	of	your	
Lord	will	you	deny?
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	apne	Rab	ki	kaun	si	ne'mat	phere	
jhutlāoge?

englishTranslationText:
And	for	one	who	fears	to	stand	before	his	
Lord,	are	two	Gardens.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jo	apne	Rab	ke	huzoor	khade	hone	se	
dare	uske	liye	do	jannateiñhaiñ

englishTranslationText:
So	O	men	and	jinns!	Which	favour	of	your	
Lord	will	you	deny?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	apne	Rab	ki	kaun	si	ne'mat	jhutlāoge?

englishTranslationText: Having	numerous	branches.
romanUrduTranslationText: Bahut	si	dāloñ	wāliyañ

englishTranslationText:
So	O	men	and	jinns!	Which	favour	of	your	
Lord	will	you	deny?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	apne	Rab	ki	kaun	si	ne'mat	jhutlāoge?

englishTranslationText: In	the	two	Gardens	flow	two	springs.
romanUrduTranslationText: Un	meiñ	do	chashme	behte	haiñ

englishTranslationText:
So	O	men	and	jinns!	Which	favour	of	your	
Lord	will	you	deny?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	apne	Rab	ki	kaun	si	ne'mat	jhutlāoge?

englishTranslationText:
In	which	are	fruits	of	all	kinds,	each	of	two	
varieties.
romanUrduTranslationText: Un	meiñ	har	mewa	do	do	qism	ka

englishTranslationText:
So	O	men	and	jinns!	Which	favour	of	your	
Lord	will	you	deny?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	apne	Rab	ki	kaun	si	ne'mat	jhutlāoge?

arabicText: مُتَّكِـِٔينَ عَلَىٰ فُرُشٍۭ بَطَآئِنُهَا مِنْ إِسْتَبْرَقٍۢ ۚ وَجَنَى ٱلْجَنَّتَيْنِ دَانٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Reclining	upon	thrones	that	are	lined	with	brocade,	with	the	fruit	of	both	Gardens	close	enough	
to	be	picked	from	under.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	aise	bichhaunoñ	par	takiya	lagaye	
jinka	astar	qanadeez	ka	aur	donoñ	ke	
mewe	itne	jhuke	huwe	ke	neeche	se	chun	lo

englishTranslationText: So	O	men	and	jinns!	Which	favour	of	your	Lord	will	you	deny?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	apne	Rab	ki	kaun	si	ne'mat	jhutlāoge?

arabicText: فِيهِنَّ قَـٰصِرَٰتُ ٱلطَّرْفِ لَمْ يَطْمِثْهُنَّ إِنسٌۭ قَبْلَهُمْ وَلَا جَآنٌّۭ
englishTranslationText:
Upon	thrones	are	the	women	who	do	not	gaze	at	men	except	their	husbands,	and	before	them,	
are	untouched	by	any	man	or	jinn.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Un	bichaunoñ	par	woh	aurteiñ	haiñ	ke	shauhar	ke	siwa	kisi	ko	āañkh	utha	kar	nahi	dekhteeiñ	
un	se	pehle	unheiñ	na	chhuwa	kisi	āadmi	aur	na	jin	ne.

englishTranslationText: So	O	men	and	jinns!	Which	favour	of	your	Lord	will	you	deny?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	apne	Rab	ki	kaun	si	ne'mat	jhutlāoge?

englishTranslationText: They	are	like	rubies	and	coral-stone.
romanUrduTranslationText: Goya	woh	l’al	aur	mooñga	haiñ

englishTranslationText: So	O	men	and	jinns!	Which	favour	of	your	Lord	will	you	deny?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	apne	Rab	ki	kaun	si	ne'mat	jhutlāoge?

englishTranslationText: What	is	the	reward	of	virtue	except	virtue	(in	return)?
romanUrduTranslationText: Neki	ka	badla	kya	hai	magar	neki

englishTranslationText: So	O	men	and	jinns!	Which	favour	of	your	Lord	will	you	deny?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	apne	Rab	ki	kaun	si	ne'mat	jhutlāoge?

englishTranslationText: And	besides	them,	there	are	two	more	Gardens.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	inke	siwa	do	Jannateiñ	aur	haiñ

englishTranslationText: So	O	men	and	jinns!	Which	favour	of	your	Lord	will	you	deny?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	apne	Rab	ki	kaun	si	ne'mat	jhutlāoge?

englishTranslationText: Densely	covered	with	foliage,	appearing	dark.
romanUrduTranslationText: Nihayat	sabzi	se	siyāhi	ki	jhalak	de	rahi	haiñ

englishTranslationText: So	O	men	and	jinns!	Which	favour	of	your	Lord	will	you	deny?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	apne	Rab	ki	kaun	si	ne'mat	jhutlāoge?

englishTranslationText: In	the	Gardens	are	two	springs,	overflowing	with	abundance.
romanUrduTranslationText: Un	meiñ	do	chashme	haiñ	chhalakte	huwe

englishTranslationText: So	O	men	and	jinns!	Which	favour	of	your	Lord	will	you	deny?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	apne	Rab	ki	kaun	si	ne'mat	jhutlāoge?

englishTranslationText:
In	them	are	fruits	(of	all	kinds),	and	dates	
and	pomegranate.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Un	meiñ	mewe	aur	khajooreiñ	aur	anār	
haiñ

englishTranslationText:
So	O	men	and	jinns!	Which	favour	of	your	
Lord	will	you	deny?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	apne	Rab	ki	kaun	si	ne'mat	jhutlāoge?

englishTranslationText:
In	them	are	women	of	good	behaviour	
and	gorgeous	faces.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Un	meiñ	aurteiñ	haiñ	āadat	ki	nek	soorat	
ki	achchi

englishTranslationText:
So	O	men	and	jinns!	Which	favour	of	your	
Lord	will	you	deny?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	apne	Rab	ki	kaun	si	ne'mat	jhutlāoge?

englishTranslationText:
They	are	houris	(maidens	of	Paradise),	
hidden	from	view,	in	pavilions.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Hooreiñ	haiñ	khaimoñ	meiñ	parda	
nasheen

englishTranslationText:
So	O	men	and	jinns!	Which	favour	of	your	
Lord	will	you	deny?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	apne	Rab	ki	kaun	si	ne'mat	jhutlāoge?

arabicText: لَمْ يَطْمِثْهُنَّ إِنسٌۭ قَبْلَهُمْ وَلَا جَآنٌّۭ
englishTranslationText:
Untouched	by	any	man	or	jinn,	before	
them.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Un	se	pehle	unheiñ	hāth	na	lagaya	kisi	
āadmi	aur	na	kisi	jinn	ne

englishTranslationText:
So	O	men	and	jinns!	Which	favour	of	your	
Lord	will	you	deny?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	apne	Rab	ki	kaun	sí	ne'mat	jhutlāoge?

arabicText: مُتَّكِـِٔينَ عَلَىٰ رَفْرَفٍ خُضْرٍۢ وَعَبْقَرِىٍّ حِسَانٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Reclining	on	green	cushions	and	beautiful	
decorated	carpets.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Takiya	lagaye	huwe	sabz	bichaunoñ	aur	
munaqqash	khoob	soorat	chāndniyoñ	par

englishTranslationText:
So	O	men	and	jinns!	Which	favour	of	your	
Lord	will	you	deny?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	apne	Rab	ki	kaun	si	ne'mat	jhutlāoge?

arabicText: تَبَـٰرَكَ ٱسْمُ رَبِّكَ ذِى ٱلْجَلَـٰلِ وَٱلْإِكْرَامِ
englishTranslationText:
Most	Auspicious	is	the	name	of	your	Lord,	
the	Most	Majestic	and	the	Most	
Honourable.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Badi	barkat	wāla	hai	tumhāre	Rab	ka	nām	
jo	ázmat	wāla	aur	buzurgi	wāla

englishTranslationText: When	the	forthcoming	event	does	occur.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jab	ho	legi	woh	hone	wāli
